revised_title: A New Approach to the Theory of Water Waves
tldr: The authors developed a two-dimensional theory for the propagation of long water waves, using a different approach than the classical non-linear long wave approximate theory. They used the Cosserat surface theory to model the fluid sheet and derived appropriate equations for an ideal incompressible fluid. The resulting theory was then specialized for motions symmetric about a fixed plane, leading to a simplified mathematical structure. The authors also used a three-dimensional approximation to suggest values for the assigned vector fields and inertia coefficient, and discussed unidirectional traveling waves, finding a solitary wave solution similar to the Korteweg-de Vries equation.
